data.prayer: Father, look after and teach the way that is best for the 20,519 believers living in Siparia, Trinidad and Tobago.
data.verse: I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go. I will counsel you with my loving eye on you.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Siparia, Trinidad and Tobago
data.section_summary: What people or resources could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Lord, raise up apostolic workers to plant churches in every town in the state of Siparia.
data.verse: The reason I left you in Crete was that you might put in order what was left unfinished and appoint elders in every town, as I directed you.

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 4 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Father, you said, "The earth belongs to Me and all that is in it". Please, call Siparia, Trinidad and Tobago into obedience and eternal life.
data.verse: The earth is Yahweh’s, with its fullness; the world, and those who dwell therein.

data.prayer: Father, send out evangelists who will challenge people like Peter who said, "Repent and be baptized, every one of you" in the state of Siparia, Trinidad and Tobago.
data.verse: Peter replied, “Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins. And you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

data.prayer: Lord, for the leaders in the state of Siparia, let the eyes of their hearts be enlightened in order that they may know the hope to which they are called.
data.verse: I pray that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened in order that you may know the hope to which he has called you, the riches of his glorious inheritance in his holy people, and his incomparably great power for us who believe.

data.prayer: Spirit, give faith and responsive hearts to the 87,000 citizens of the the state of Siparia.
data.verse: Seek the Lord while he may be found; call upon him while he is near.

data.prayer: Father, be a refuge and strength for the hurting in Siparia, Trinidad and Tobago today.
data.verse: God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble.
